intro: Echium collinum, commonly known as the hill flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Echium collinum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
